intro: Pedicularis attenuata, commonly known as the slender monkey orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its distinctive, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with a long, slender spur that extends from the base of the petals. Pedicularis attenuata is often found in open woodlands and meadows, where it forms dense colonies during the flowering season.
